comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "Richmond Pearson Hobson (August 17, 1870 – March 16, 1937) was a United States Navy Rear Admiral who served from 1907-1915 as a U.S. Representative from Alabama. A veteran of the Spanish-American War, he received the Medal of Honor years later for his part in that conflict." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richmond_P._Hobson See also www.arlingtoncemetery.net/rphobson.htm An advertising in Ashland tidings., November 11, 1915, Page 7 (with photo) described him as one of the most noted leader of the Anti-Saloon forces in America. According to The Era-leader., March 02, 1916, Image 2 (with photo) he was the floor leader of the prohibition party of the House.
